WorkItem.ClosedComment: Rawr 4.0.17 Released. If this is still an issue in this new version, please reopen the issue per the Posting Guidelines with all of the necessary information.
WorkItem.Description:
When I press the Export Stats button it doesn't copy it to the clip board.
Â 
Steps to reproduce:
Copy some text from a text editor into the clip board.
Open an enhancement shaman in Rawr
Go to the EnhSim tab on the Options tab
Click Export Stats to EnhSim config file
Press copy from clipboard in EnhSim and you will get a clipboard parse error
Open a new text editor and press Control-V.  You will see your original text
WorkItem.Summary: [Enhance] Export Stats to EnhSim config file button doesn't work

Comments.Message:
Even if it did work it wouldn't export a Cata version of EnhSim config file, as that is still to be done.

The only automated export available for Cata at present is via in game addon ShockAndAwe.
Checked with the WPF version and when you press the export button it closes down Rawr altogether.

Just an update: am now working to resolve this.  Thanks to Chaotique for some patches that will help.

Not sure yet what is wrong with the Silverlight version, but the WPF version is getting a" System.StackOverflowException" when trying to copy the text to the clipboard.
I believe I have fixed the "Export Stats to EnhSim" button for the WPF version.  Have attached an example output file from a test file.
Sorry Jothay, un-tagging this as fixed for tracking purposes.  Still need to fix the silverlight version.
Why is the Silverlight version not working when the WPF one does? Isn't it using the same code?

No, Silverlight uses a different code because of permissions in copying to clipboard.  (Note this is "export to enhsim specific", the rest of the Enhance module shares code between the two.  As it should).

Levva has given me a heads on looking at the code for the Rawr.Addon, and seeing if I can borrow parts of it.

Good news!  Have tweaked the code from the addon import, and have got a working export to enhsim for silverlight.

Fixed for next release.
